alert.note: Alert for South Washington Coast (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 09 at 2:50AM PST until January 09 at 5:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 5 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON for minor tidal overflow... * WHAT...Minor Tidal overflow flooding expected. * WHERE...South Washington Coast. * WHEN...From noon today to 5 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding, up to one foot above ground level, during high tide is expected in the low lying areas near bays, sloughs, and the lower reaches of the coastal rivers. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Total tide at Toke Point is expected to be 11.5 ft at 2 PM Monday afternoon. A tide of this magnitude will likely impact some fields and pastures.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory means that tidal overflow flooding is expected. Coastal residents in the warned area should be alert for rising water, and take appropriate action to protect life and property.
